Package ucpbased

Class UCP

java.lang.Object
ucpbased.UCP
public final class UCP
extends java.lang.Object
This UCP class represents a framework for calculating the Use Case Points.
Author:
Zhamri Che Ani

  • Constructor Details

    • UCP

      public UCP()
      This constructor if for creating new objects.

  • Method Details

    • input_UUCW

      public void input_UUCW​(int simple, int average, int complex)
      This method is for calculating the use case complexity based on three inputs. Use case complexity is classified into three categories: simple, average and complex.
      Parameters:
      simple - A simple use case is referring to three or fewer number of transactions.
      average - An average use case is referring to four to seven number of transactions.
      complex - A complex use case is referring to more than seven number of transactions.

    • input_UAW

      public void input_UAW​(int simple, int average, int complex)
      This method is for calculating the actor complexity based on three inputs. Actor complexity is classified into three categories: simple, average and complex.
      Parameters:
      simple - A simple actor is referring to another system that communicates via a pre-defined API.
      average - An average actor is referring to either human beings or another system interacting through a well-defined protocol such as TCP/IP.
      complex - A complex actor is referring to a person interacting through a GUI or a Web page.

    • input_TCF

      public void input_TCF​(int t1_Assessment, int t2_Assessment, int t3_Assessment, int t4_Assessment, int t5_Assessment, int t6_Assessment, int t7_Assessment, int t8_Assessment, int t9_Assessment, int t10_Assessment, int t11_Assessment, int t12_Assessment, int t13_Assessment)
      This method is for calculating the technical complexity based on 13 factors.
      Parameters:
      t1_Assessment - Distributed system required.
      t2_Assessment - Response time is important.
      t3_Assessment - End-user efficiency.
      t4_Assessment - Complex internal processing required.
      t5_Assessment - Reusable code must be a focus.
      t6_Assessment - Easy to install.
      t7_Assessment - Easy to use.
      t8_Assessment - Cross-platform support.
      t9_Assessment - Easy to change.
      t10_Assessment - Highly concurrent.
      t11_Assessment - Custom security.
      t12_Assessment - Dependence on third-party code.
      t13_Assessment - User training.

    • input_ECF

      public void input_ECF​(int e1_Assessment, int e2_Assessment, int e3_Assessment, int e4_Assessment, int e5_Assessment, int e6_Assessment, int e7_Assessment, int e8_Assessment)
      This method is for calculating the environmental complexity based on eight factors.
      Parameters:
      e1_Assessment - Familiarity with the project.
      e2_Assessment - Application experience.
      e3_Assessment - Object-oriented programming experience.
      e4_Assessment - Lead analyst capability.
      e5_Assessment - Motivation.
      e6_Assessment - Stable requirements.
      e7_Assessment - Part-time staff.
      e8_Assessment - Difficult programming language.

      Returns:
      UCP (Use Case Points)
